titles.title: Rural Physicians Relief Act of 2007
A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a tax credit to rural primary health providers.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

bill.summary: 1/12/2007--Introduced. Rural Physicians Relief Act of 2007 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow certain primary health services providers (i.e., physicians and licensed mental health care practitioners) a tax credit of $1,000 for each month such providers provide medical care to rural patients in certain sparsely populated areas of the United States.
